intro: Veronica sibirica var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
